fields.description:
Allow user or admin to add watches for others on an issue.

during creation perhaps, in the main window. we want to assign watches by name. like a CC of assignment so to speak.
fields.summary: Allow user or admin to add watches for others on an issue

fields.description:
I've installed JIRA, and entered the wrong SMTP server. How/where do I change the setting?

I've looked in the db, and some XML files, but I can't find it anywhere.
fields.summary: How/where do I change the SMTP server name?

fields.description: Document creating and editing link types, as well as linking issues together and deleting links.
fields.summary: Document issue linking

fields.description:
Add the ability to create a linked issue. 

For example when viewing issue A, you could click 'create linked issue' and it would send you to the create form - with an additional select box for the link type. The form could be prefilled with data from the original issue (ie project, component, versions etc).

Useful when creating sub issues.
fields.summary: Created linked issue
Automatic issue linking

fields.description: Move the attachment path and activation/deactivation of attachments into their own admin page (like Indexing).
fields.summary: Create "Attachments" administration page

fields.description: When deleting a version (or component) you get a number of affected issues. It would be nice to also provide a link to a filter which shows what issues those are.
fields.summary: When deleting a version/component, provide filter links

fields.description:
Permissions structure for attachments is not consistent.

Things to fix:

- description on permissions page
- viewing attachments page 
- deleting attachments (only if delete permission)
- attaching attachments (only if attach permission)

Fix up icon & mimetype recognition too.
fields.summary: Attachment Permissions not consistent

fields.description:
Our SMTP server requires authentication to send email. Would it be possible to extend the SMTP listener to accept a username/password for the SMTP server?

Thanks.
fields.summary: support for authenticated SMTP

fields.description:
At the moment the default entityengine.xml file is confusing to new users.

We should rewrite it with simpler docs, explaining what needs to be modified for what servers. 

It should only include a single datasource, and tell the user how to modify it for each different driver.
fields.summary: Rewrite default entityengine.xml to be simpler

fields.description:
Hi -

I am interested to use Jira to do some project management work, specifically assigning task and tracking them.

However, when opening a new issue (task), I don't seems to be able to find input fields such as 'scheduled start date', 'scheduled end date'.  Although there is a time tracking feature, it is not exactly what i am looking for.

Is there a feature that will allow me to have the ability to input scheduled start and end date?

ph
fields.summary: PM, Task scheduling and tracking

fields.description:
Hi there,
It would be good if the 'lead developer' field on the 'edit project' page offered a dropdown list of users, rather than forcing manually typing the user id.
Not sure, but this might be useful elsewhere too - I'm one for not having to be forced to fully enter data more than once! :)
Thanks,

Mike
fields.summary: Drop-down for user selection

fields.description: Allow the user to select more than one Fix For Version to filter by at one time, or have it so Unreleased and Released are selectable choices to filter by.  If neither of these are possible, could there be a progress bar for all the unreleased versions where the user could click on the red part to get the unresolved issues.
fields.summary: Allow filtering by more than one Fix For Version

fields.description:
We should rewrite the dashboard to be portal-like (akin to something like my.yahoo.com).

Different 'portlets' can be added to the left and right columns, and reodered.

Two different types of portlets initially - saved filters and projects.
- Saved filters can have a max number of issues to display, and a sort order.
- Projects store whether to display a 'full display' or a brief one.

Also maybe default portlets for non-selected projects, introduction and saved filters?

What to do about Administration portlet?
fields.summary: Portal-like dashboard

fields.description:
Now I cannot change time of service executing without removing it and add it again. 

I think that it's not a big work to add delay on edit service parameters screen.
fields.summary: Editing service entry
Migrate Manager classes to internal Commands
IssueEvent should take both a comment and a changelog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-634].
  {panel}

Hi,

Not sure if this is outside the scope of the project but here's an idea.  We now have the perfect issue-resolution work flow with Jira, where users report an issue, we resolve it, then they close it once they've tested the resolution.  (Just to clarify, our 'users' give us a spec for the applications that we develop and so are internal, not Joe Public...)

It would be a great extension of this workflow to apply it to versions of projects as well as to individual bugs.  This would mean that our users can 'sign-off' a version as being complete and ready for deployment to production.

Would anyone else find this useful?  Currently we do all our great work in Jira then have to go to Lotus Notes for sign-off (!)  Linking to Jira's roadmap of course ;)  Which almost works...! (JRA-633)

  Mike
fields.summary: Have users 'Sign-off' versions of the projects

fields.description:
You can link to the roadmap or the changelog directly from an external site using the following URL:

http://hostname/jira/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10000&report=roadmap

We have two projects, project A needs users to login for browsing, project B does not.  We want to link to the secure project (A) using this hyperlink.  We expect a login challenge, followed by project A's roadmap.  However, Jira actually displays the non-secure project (project B) unless you are already logged in.

This is the same for the changelog.
fields.summary: Link to roadmap from external site doesn't work if permissioned

fields.description: When an issue is resolved (but not closed), then sent to a member of QA to verify that resolution and close the issue, the status changes back to assigned.  It would be nice (for filtering and other reasons) to have the status stay as resolved after it is resolved.
fields.summary: Keep Status of Resolved until reopened

fields.description:
Once an issue has been opened in a project, that issue cannot be reassigned to a different project.  Typically in a large, complicated system an issue may be raised for one project, but its later discovered that the real problem originates in a different project.

The only workaround at the moment is to close the bug and reopen it in the other project.  The drawback is that all of the bug history is now lost.
fields.summary: Reassign issue to another project

fields.description: jira does not support multi-bype language to input and view. It's seem to be a problem for webwork.
fields.summary: Can't support multi-byte language

fields.description: When viewing an issue from the results of a filter search, it would be nice to have Previous and Next links at the top of the issue to get to the surrounding issues of the results (based on how the results were sorted), without having to click back to the results and select another issue.
fields.summary: Previous and Next links when viewing an issue would help

fields.description: We'd liek the ability to customize the columns displayed in a filter.  In particular, the we need to display the description in some filters, and the time-spent/estimated-time-remaining in other filters.
fields.summary: customize filter columns

fields.description: For example, he should be able to create versions, to release versions. Currently a admin must login, not very elegant.
fields.summary: Project leader should be able to change project settings
Create Issue|Fix For Version: only unreleased versions make sense

fields.description: The FileService code (which I wrote!) is abstract and needs a FileCommentService and a FileCvsService, just like the pop services that are available. I didn't write those classes because the [File|Pop]CvsService and [File|Pop]CommentService code both work the same and duplicated that code wouldn't have been dumb, so I figured you guys could find a way to make them work a little nicer together (maybe a Util class to parse the messages?). Anyway, I'd like to see this finished soon. I might try to write them myself (redundant code), but I think it'd be best if you guys did it in the long run.
fields.summary: FileService isn't finished

fields.description: As it is possible to add comments when resolving and closing an issue - it would be logical to have the ability to add similar comments when reopening issues as well.
fields.summary: Add comment while re-opening an issue
Full Content shows *all* versions in the Affects Versions field

fields.description:
Especially when "Allow unassigned issues" is deactivated and there are no unassigned issues, hide this entry on the Browse Project page (lower right corner).

I know, there can remain unassigned issues, even if the above mentioned option is deactivated, but if the number is 0, it should be hidden.
fields.summary: Hide "Unassigned 0" on the Browse Project page

fields.description:
When the email-listener is removed, you do not have the possibility to get the password sent by JIRA from the login-page.

Solution suggestion:
Let the admin always enter a valid email server and email setting and allow the user to customize when he should be notified on a per-event base.
fields.summary: Cannot send password, when email notification is switched off

fields.description: Instead of removing this listener to deactivate the email-sending, add an extra option to the listener, that enables/disables it.
fields.summary: Email listener: add option for activating

fields.description:
500 Internal Server Error
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.ViewServices.doValidation(ViewServices.java:65)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.validate(ActionSupport.java:319)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:105)
	at webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher.service(ServletDispatcher.java:220)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:336)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._ie.doFilter(.:59)
	at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.parsePage(Unknown Source)
	at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.doFilter(Unknown Source)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._ic.doFilter(.:16)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:208)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._ic.doFilter(.:20)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.security.LoginFilter.doFilter(LoginFilter.java:194)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._deb._lnc(.:376)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._deb._wmb(.:170)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._co._wbb(.:581)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._co._fs(.:189)
	at com.evermind[Orion/1.5.4 (build 10585)]._bt.run(.:62)
fields.summary: Edit service: Cancel button broken
You cannot change the Delay of an existing service

fields.description:
The XML import treats free text boxes as CDATA & exports them in their own element.  ie:

"<body><![CDATA[[Version] [.8] was added
[Version] [1.0] was removed
[Fix For] set to [1.0]
]]
fields.summary: XML Import loses data from free-text fields

fields.description:
I act as the lead on our projects so when those testing finds a bug etc. the issues are initially assigned to me.

When I assign issues to the developers I find that I most of the time first add a comment to point the devloper in the right direction and then assign the developer to the issue.

It would be nice if the assign screen allowed me to type in comments - then I would not have to visit the commens page before assigning.
fields.summary: Add comments to and assign an issue on the sae screen
Full Content shows all versions in Affects Versions for every issue

fields.description:
JIRA is sending email notiffications to me when I update an issue. This is not really needed as I know I updated the issue. 

Also, the level of email notifications that are sent should be customisable by the user.  The ability to choose the various levels like (notify me on change of status, on resolution, on update etc).

In addition add the option to notify the lead developer for a project (currently it is only assignee and reporter). This would help environments where allow unassigned is turned on.
fields.summary: change to  email notifcation

fields.description:
The home screen currently displays a short list of Assigned To Me and In Progress issues with links to Watches, Report By Me, and Voted issue below.

It would be nice for users to be able to customise which category of issues are display ina short list and the remainder being links below that.

The reasoning is simply that depending on security acces rights you may not be able to have issues assined to yourself and are more interested in the issues you reported or are watching.
fields.summary: Ability to customise the home screen

fields.description: If you are working on a issue (it is assigned to you and has a status of In Progress) there is no need to have the issue appear in both the Assigned To Me and In Progress issue list on the home page.
fields.summary: Change the Assigned To Me issue list on the home screen to ezclude In Progress Issues
It's unpredictable how much issues are listed in the Full Content view

fields.description:
Especially if the issues are viewed as Full Content and the (hopefully near-)future possibility to have options for what should be visible (JRA-605).

The resolution comment might contain some information, how something needs to be done correctly, but a "normal" comment may contain some information from the developers (e.g. "is related to xxx") the customer needs not to know.
fields.summary: Separate resolution comment from "normal" comments

fields.description: We need the ability to hide some fields, like the reporter (it's the boy who enters the issue in our company, not the customer), the assignee or the environment (we use for tracking the customer who reported the issue) to generate a issue summary, we can send to our customers.
fields.summary: Options for what to show in Full Content view

fields.description: For some unknown reason, JIRA sporadically sends completely empty emails over night (no subject, no content).
fields.summary: JIRA sends empty emails

fields.description:
The current interface provides for searching for issues by Issue Key (either "JRA-XXX" or just "XXX" if you are in the JRA project).

Extend this functionality to be a free-text search if it is not in AAA-### or ### format.
fields.summary: Implement quick search feature on every page.
Add upgrade pricing and support details to JIRA website

fields.description: The build file shipped with the source license is very out of date - it needs to be updated.
fields.summary: Client build file needs updating

fields.description:
We are currently evaluating JIRA and find it meets (or usually exceeds) most of our needs.

However, one thing we have in our current bug tracker is a field to specify a "sponsor" for each issue. 

While I may report the problem, the sponsor is the person responsible for ensuring the bug gets fixed (either a project manager or business owner).

Any chance of adding this, or getting the ability to add our own data fields?
fields.summary: Custom fields (eg. Sponsor)

fields.description:
From Joe Walnes (via email):

  - provide Linux RPM file with a script like /etc/rc.d/init.d/jira
[start|stop] (feel free to rip off the one I stuck on OrionSupport).

  - create one click Windows installer (which even puts custom icons and
url links in the start menu) : Install Anywhere have a free version.

  - for Win NT/2K, install as a service that auto-starts and runs in the
background : http://www.kcmultimedia.com/javaserv/
fields.summary: Create Installer for JIRA standalone
Hide "Assigned to me" on the HOME-page if I'm not assignable

fields.description:
They don't seem to download very well.

Have to investigate further.  May not be limited to images either.
fields.summary: Viewing image attachments doesn't work

fields.description: Now that we are selling academic licenses, we should make an academic license key that we can use.
fields.summary: Create Academic License Key

fields.description:
I've reported this issue a few weeks ago in the mailing list, but lost track of it and could not find it in JIRA-JIRA.

Please sort the Road Map entries by resolution first and than -- for issues with the same resolution state -- by priority. This would show the opened, high priority issues first, followed by opened, lower priority, followed by solved, high priority and solved, lower priority.

Cheers,
Tom

(See JRA-592)
fields.summary: Sort the Road Map by multiple columns (priority and resolution)

fields.description: (see JRA-564) I saved the web site to the disk and ran TIDY over it. It shows some errors like discarding unexpected isn't allowed in elements inserting implicite table trimming empty table proprietary attribute value "absmiddle" beside the warnings like lacks "summary" attribute lacks "alt" attribute When sending these files to the customer I do not have a good feeling.
fields.summary: HTML error in new Full content view

fields.description:
Currently the issue tables are only sorted by one column. It would be much better, if the previous sortings would be kept. Example:

1) The table is sorted by the Priority column to show high priorities on top.
2) When pressing the Status column, I want to see the open high priorities on top, followed by open low priorities, followed by solved high priorites, followed by solved low priorities.
fields.summary: Better sorting in the issue tables

fields.description:
Instead of user groups to tasks, it would be better to manage these permissions in the opposite way: assign the tasks to the user groups. Example:

jira-administrators:
  Administration
  Delete issues

jira-developers:
  Edit issues
  Assign issues
  Resolve issues
  Assignable user

jira-users:
  Browse projects
  Create issues
  Add comments
  Create attachments

I'm not sure about the JIRA Users permission; I would guess, every user should be able to use it -- that's why it is a user.
fields.summary: Opposite permission relations

fields.description:
I tried to add the example Export service, but needed some time to figure out, how to specify the export directory.

It would be nice, if JIRA could automatically show the properties page after pressing the Add Service button.
fields.summary: Adding a service should automatically show their properties page
Add mailing list unsubscribe instructions to mailing list page

fields.description:
JRA-329 deals with in introduction on a server level, but it would be useful to have a URL & an introduction per project.

This would be seen on the Browse Project Page.
fields.summary: URL & Introduction should be on a project level

fields.description:
For the CreateIssue page, the "descriptions" for the input boxes should be customisable on an application level.

eg:  JIRA 1.3 has the text "For example operating system, software platform and/or hardware specifications (include as appropriate for the issue)." under the environment input box.

This should be customisable (and we should provide defaults out-of-the-box).
fields.summary: Customise field descriptions for createIssue

fields.description:
Allow the user to set the background colour of the top two bars, the text colour of the menu text (which I think is already done in CSS - perhaps do in JSP instead?).

In addition, allow the user to specify a user-icon instead of the JIRA icon in the top-left of the screen.

We would need:
- URL
- width
- height

if the URL began with "http://" then we would list as-is.  If it started with "/" then prepend with <%= request.getContextPath() %>.
fields.summary: Configurable colour scheme and icons for JIRA

fields.description:
At the moment it is possible to have the admin group not being part of the users group.

This potentially means that there can be admins who cannot login to JIRA.  Worst case could mean that there are no admins who can login to JIRA.

Fix would mean that in the actions, any groups with "administration permission" would also be in  "use permission".

A corrollory to this is to ensure that users cannot remove their own administration permission.  This will always mean that there is at least one user with administration permission & that group will also have "use permission".

This caused this problem: JRA-583
fields.summary: Ensure that Admin groups are always member of "USE" group

fields.description:
Add documentation explaining the different issue navigator views.

This should be linked from the issue navigator as a help icon.

A special section (or perhaps a new document) should be written on the RSS API and view. (see the example docs for the Oreilly meerkat API - http://www.oreillynet.com/pub/a/rss/2000/05/09/meerkat_api.html?page=4)
fields.summary: Documentation for Issue Navigator Views

fields.description:
Why not a bit more shameless self-promotion?

For mozilla - also use:

<link REL="icon" HREF="location/of/icon" TYPE="image/png">
fields.summary: Add a favicon.ico file for JIRA

fields.description:
(From Thomas Singer):

 I open the calendar from the Find Issue page. Lets say, it shows July 2002. If I press the right arrow image button, it switches to November 1899. I don't believe, I have such old issues ;-)
fields.summary: Date popup javascript doesn't work in Opera

fields.description: The link links to "-1".  This should be fixed to be "unassigned".
fields.summary: Unassigned Issues link from Browse Project is incorrectly linked
Remove "Popular Issues" if voting is disabled

fields.description: These links should show the issue table with all the issues assigned for this version.
fields.summary: Make the version numbers in the Roadmap and the Changelog links

fields.description:
Green + Red bar that turns more green the more issues that are resolved.

When a version is 100% green it is ready to release.
fields.summary: Provide progress bar per version in Browse Project

fields.description:
This link doesn't work because of the misplaced '&' near the 'pid' parameter.

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&&pid=10240sorter/order=ASC&sorter/field=priority&resolutionIds=-1&component=10120

Here the correct link: I add the '&' between sorter and 10240.

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&mode=hide&pid=10240&sorter/order=ASC&sorter/field=priority&resolutionIds=-1&component=10120
fields.summary: Find issues by component from "browse project" screen doesn't work

fields.description:
As projects use JIRA for longer - the version number dropdown gets longer & longer.

Investigate ways of improving the version number interface.

Possible ways include re-ordering the dropdown boxes - or possibly starting with a small number & then filling it if the user wishes to look for other versions (either using javascript or back to server).
fields.summary: Improve version number dropdown UI

fields.description: Create issue page currently has no way to set an initial estimate for the issue.
fields.summary: Add estimate to create issue page

fields.description:
If you are not logged in & you do not have permissions to browse project, it presents you a link on the left of the dashboard to login or signup.

Do not present the sign-up link if it is a private issue tracker.
fields.summary: Do not present sign-up link if not public JIRA installation

fields.description: As you cannot progress any issue if it is resolved or closed - remove the information from the view issue page.
fields.summary: Remove Progress Action is issue is resolved

fields.description:
The default search order for Issue Navigator was changed in recent builds.

It used to be search by key (descending), which basically was most recently added first.

It should be returned to either sort by key, or sort by updated date (which gives most recently changed).

I think that in most cases you are interested in the most recently added (at first), as these are the issues that you are likely to have not seen yet.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator default search order

fields.description: This is my application server.  We're trying to get it to work as well.
fields.summary: Support running JIRA on iPlanet 6.0

fields.description:
when working towards a release a number of builds occur. QA needs to be able to tell when something is marked as fixed in version 1.3 whether its actually fixed in the version 1.3 that they are using (e.g. 1.3 build 123 vs. 1.3 build 144)  this would be too cumbersome to use in the versions screen.

a build number has to be tied to a given release since some projects start the build numbers over for each release.

as for assigning the build number to features, I used to use starteam and it had a cool feature where clicking "resolved" could assign it to the build number of "next", then when the next build number was created/entered, all the existing issues (within that release) with a build number of "next" were assigned to that number.
fields.summary: support for build labels within versions

fields.description:
it would be nice to be able to mark filters as public or private. currently all filters appear to be private.

pre-defined filters such as "ALL", "Outstanding", "Unscheduled", etc. should all be implemented as "public" filters and defined out of the box but be editable (e.g. some installations might want to change the time frame for 'updated recently')
fields.summary: public/private filters

fields.description: Seeing as Mike has written some great docs on search query syntax - we should link them from JIRA's search box.
fields.summary: Link to Query

fields.description:
For summary pages on Browse Project (road map, changelog & popular issues), and user profile (User summary reports), include a link to the Issue Navigator for the same report.

This would allow people to get more information / fields if they required them.
fields.summary: Make the version numbers in the Roadmap and the Changelog links

fields.description:
To purchase, we need the ability to print all issues (from an issue table) with all its content (description, environment, comments, ...). For each report it should be customizable, what field should be printed (e.g. to remove the assignee or the reporter).

The best solution seems to be an HTML output something like this and let the browser print it out (PDF generation would be too perfect):
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| Summary                                                    |
+--------------+--------------------------+------------------+
| Reporter     | Affected versions        | Fix for version  |
+--------------+--------------------------+------------------+
| Component(s) | Attachments                                 |
+--------------+---------------------------------------------+
| Description                                                |
|                                                            |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| Environment                                                |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| Comment 1                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| Comment 2                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------+

+------------------------------------------------------------+
| Summary for next issue                                     |
....
fields.summary: Printable detailled issue report

fields.description:
A filter should be available as an RSS feed.

Requirements:

First Stage
- Anonymous RSS
- Browse Project permission must then exist for Anyone for RSS to be enabled
- Another view added in IssueNavigator for RSS

Second Stage (future)
- allow logging on to RSS with username & password.
- requirement for Browse project permission removed.
fields.summary: Saved filters as RSS feeds

fields.description: At the moment there is the possibility (though small) of duplicate keys being generated.
fields.summary: Possibility for duplicate issue keys

fields.description: At a minimum - we should link the summary using the "title" attribute.  Potentially also link the issue's status.
fields.summary: Bugs linking should include more information

fields.description: As we have added the new status of "closed" we need to change the linking to strike-out this status also.
fields.summary: Links to Issues are not struck through if "Closed"

fields.description:
As mozilla no longer supports the ALT tag for tool-tips, we should be supporting the title tag as well.

http://www.gerbilbox.com/newzilla/webdesign/tnt02.php
fields.summary: Issue Types do not have title tag
Please include a SMTP server in the standalone bundle

fields.description:
It would be very cool, if JIRA has the ability to be accessed from a Swing client, because applications are much more user friendly than web interfaces (although JIRA is the best, I've ever had seen).

This would make it very easy to integrate JIRA for instance in any IDE or into any version control system (e.g. SmartCVS).

An interesting solution could be ULC (http://www.canoo.com/ulc -- looks very promising).
fields.summary: Swing client interface; API for accessing the server
Reject release, if not all issues are solved within this issue group
Show the "Fix For Version" on the Browser Project|Popular Issues page

fields.description:
(from Gamini)
After compiling with ANT, I found that the ear did not contain the .war file
and when I copied \\jira\dist\atlassian-jira-1.3.ear into
\\orion\applications\ directory and edited the XMLs. Orion created the
required directories but naturally without web components from the war file.
fields.summary: EAR doesn't contain WAR

fields.description:
The URL of the standalone JIRA should be http://localhost:8080/ but it turns up at http://localhost:8080/atlassian-jira-1.3.1

Possibly the context is the problem?
fields.summary: Standalone URL is wrong

fields.description:
When I create a filter and give it a name that has spaces in it and then try to show that filter I get an error.  On ya'lls web site I get a nice neat error stating that the filter could not be displayed.  On my JIRA appliation, using the same Netscape browser I get the following error message:  
Bad Request

Your browser sent a request that this server could not understand.

The request line contained invalid characters following the protocol string.


the offending url is: http://localhost/jira13/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestName=Issues with test in the comments.

In other browsers (IE, Konqueror) the spaces are encoded in the url like: http://localhost/jira13/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestName=Issues%20with%20test%20in%20the%20comments.

Also, I added a comment to JRA-405 about tab placing the focus from the username on the login form into the address bar.  The issue had been resolved so I didn't know if you still get e-mail notifications, but I am still seeing this behaviour in version 1.3.1.

Most of our users will be Netscape users...
fields.summary: Error in Netscape when space in filter name

fields.description:
I receive the following error on the dashboard page after upgrading from 1.2 to 1.3.1:  

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Source may not be null
	at webwork.util.SubsetIteratorFilter.setSource(SubsetIteratorFilter.java:33)
